data: ICU/HAU Fecal Management System (FMS) (Flexi Seal) for Burn-Injured Patients (Module)
Do not insert FMS if any contraindications are present as per policy. Use caution for patients on anticoagulant or antiplatelet therapy, or with high risk of bleeding
For general patients requiring FMS to contain infectious stool or protect from skin breakdown use ICU Fecal Management System (FMS) (Flexi Seal) PowerPlan
Prior to FMS insertion, abdominal x-ray to rule out constipation or impaction
Before FMS insertion, remove rectal devices (i.e. rectal probe)
Before FMS insertion to rule out fecal impaction, assess anal sphincter muscle tone, and rule out anal stricture
Do not insert any rectal devices (e.g. rectal probe) or any rectal medications while FMS in situ
When constipation/impaction resolved, notify provider to order abdominal x-ray
Monitor position of black indicator line q6h and document as per FMS Clinical Practice Document. If needed, reposition FMS as per policy
q6h, mark stool collection bag with black marker and record output
Indication: to PROTECT burns/grafts/donor sites, involving the peri-anal or inner thigh, or posterior thigh or buttock
Post FMS Insertion, consider discontinuing previous Head of Bed order
Discontinue all laxatives and bowel protocols
For bowel preparation prior to FMS insertion. Soap suds enema, 500 to 1000 mL, PR, q12h interval PRN, up to 4 doses until resolution of constipation
130 mL, rectal, q12h, PRN other (see comment), order duration: 4 doses or times, drug form: enema
magnesium citrate 15 g/300 mL oral liq
7.5 g, NG-tube, q12h, PRN other (see comment), order duration: 4 doses or times, drug form: oral liq
7.5 g, ND-tube, q12h, PRN other (see comment), order duration: 4 doses or times, drug form: oral liq
7.5 g, PO, q12h, PRN other (see comment), order duration: 4 doses or times, drug form: oral liq
17 g, NG-tube, q6h, drug form: powder
17 g, ND-tube, q6h, drug form: powder
17 g, PO, QID, drug form: powder
Faeces, Unit collect, qweek interval for 28 day
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, q2day for 28 day
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qMonThu for 28 day
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, qMonThu for 28 day
If/when conditions met as per order comments, then remove FMS
If/when any conditions noted in order comments, then do not administer PEG solution, hold feeds, obtain an abdominal X-ray, and notify provider
